text: - Exxeta is one of the main partners
driving digitization within Germany,
but also parts of Europe.
We have three focus areas industries,

which are mobility, energy,
and financial services.
We help companies that are already big

to grow faster or to
change, to be more agile,
but also to help smaller companies
to grow and leverage their business.

Most of the customers
use on-premise services.
Our customers get more open
to use also cloud-based services.

So AWS more and more came into
focus as probable platform
to run solutions on.
And we of course, very early adopted AWS,
especially for our development systems,
where we use it first.

But then of course,
together with our customers,

explored possibilities,
how to run our solutions,

which are most of them,
very business critical,
in the cloud.
Solve this issue or this challenge,
we actually used AppStream.

AppStream made it possible
to stream the application
to the customer over the browser.
So it's very easy access for the customer.
Just opens the browser,

and immediately can see
the application can run

and work with it as it
would be on his desktop.
That makes it very easy
to bring up new features, and so on.

When we roll out a new
version of the solution,
it's very easy.
Formerly, we needed to package it,

and then install it on like
50-plus client computers.
Now we don't need it anymore.

We just install it in
the cloud, and that's it.
Everybody has the newest version.

We have these customers,
and of course this solution
we host in the cloud, as our solution.

And of course we rely on a
working cloud environment,
which is highly scalable, efficient,

to give this good solution
and services to our customers.
And AWS really does the job for us.
They really help us in growing,

and of course, shifting
with our customers,

our solutions from formally
on-premise solutions
to the cloud.
(upbeat music)
